plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A shade-loving perennial with striking white flowers that can sometimes bloom from late winter to early spring, including February. It thrives in temperate European gardens.
plants.funFact: Despite its name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose and is known for being toxic if ingested.

plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A popular early-blooming bulbous plant that emerges through the snow, bringing splashes of purple, yellow, or white to gardens and wild meadows in temperate regions.
plants.funFact: Crocuses are among the first flowers to bloom after winter, signaling the coming of spring.

plants.name: Prunus campanulata
plants.description: This cherry species blooms early in the year, sometimes starting in February, producing stunning clusters of bright pink flowers. Itâ€™s native to Taiwan and is cultivated in subtropical and tropical areas.
plants.funFact: Taiwan Cherry blossoms are celebrated in festivals and are admired for their vibrant color earlier than many other cherry trees.

plants.name: Eremophila maculata
plants.description: A drought-tolerant Australian native shrub that blooms in various seasons, including winter months like February, with tubular red, orange, or yellow flowers attractive to birds.
plants.funFact: Eremophila species produce nectar-rich flowers that are important for native pollinators in arid zones.
